data.title: Corporate Teams — Hearst RISE DE&I
data.text:
SPOTLIGHT

Neurodiversity @ Hearst

Recognizing cognitive diversity as part of its commitment to inclusion, Hearst is rolling out a suite of efforts including Neurodiversity@Hearst —a 15-week apprenticeship pilot for neurodivergent talent, including individuals with autism and ADHD. By enhancing neuroinclusive hiring and managerial practices, Hearst embraces how diverse cognitive perspectives enrich the workplace and foster innovation. Hearst also offers all colleagues free access to Joshin, a support system for disability and neurodivergence in the workplace through personalized navigation, live coaching and self-guided digital programs.

Inclusive Benefits

At the core of Hearst's culture is a shared belief that the best work comes from fostering an environment of inclusion and diversity, and Hearst is committed to doing everything it can to make all colleagues and their loved ones feel included and supported — especially in the benefits Hearst offers. The holistic health and wellness of all colleagues is the company’s priority, and it offers industry-leading benefits to support their physical, financial, emotional and family wellbeing. The company is at its best when colleagues are at theirs. Recognizing the diverse needs of colleagues, Hearst emphasizes prevention, health maintenance and tailored care solutions, stability and mental wellness resources, comprehensive family building benefits, financial support and seminars on a range of topics, from preparing for retirement to allyship and managing trauma.

SPOTLIGHT

Hearst Conversations

The In Conversation With series invites a diverse array of thought leaders to share their perspectives with colleagues. In 2023, the series welcomed fashion designer Christian Siriano, Saturday Night Live actress Ego Nwodim, actor and author Kal Penn, Founding Executive Director of the African American Cultural Heritage Action Fund Brent Leggs, Tony Award-winning actress and author Ali Stroker, among many others, for important discussions with Hearst colleagues.

The T. Howard Foundation

Since 2017, Hearst has partnered with the T. Howard Foundation, a nonprofit organization committed to increasing diversity in the media industry. For eight weeks every summer, more than 25 paid interns work across all Hearst businesses and participate in programming to gain real-world experience, skills and mentorship from Hearst colleagues.

LEARN MORE ABOUT THE T. HOWARD FOUNDATION

A+E Networks

A+E Networks is passionately committed to building an inclusive and high-impact culture that inspires creativity, collaboration, coordination, accountability and trust. The Diversity Report aims to promote transparency and accountability as the company moves forward on this journey.

A+E Networks is a joint venture of Disney-ABC Television Group and Hearst.

EXPLORE A+E NETWORKS’ 2023 DE&I REPORT
